title: IT employee union NITES demands investigation into EY employee’s death
description: The issue is also being taken up in the Parliament, as Rajya Sabha Member of Parliament (MP) Saket Gokhale said that he has formally written to the Labour Secretary of Maharashtra demanding an urgent investigation be launched into the working conditions at EY which allegedly led to the death of Perayil.
content: IT employee union Nascent Information Technology Employees Senate (NITES) has called for an “independent and thorough investigation” into the death of the 26-year-old Anna Sebastian Perayil, a chartered accountant who worked at Ernst & Young (EY).The union has formally submitted letters to both the Ministry of Labour and Employment, as well as the Ministry of Home Affairs for the same, NITES said in a statement.NITES has called upon both ministries to thoroughly investigate the circumstances surrounding her death and hold those responsible accountable.The demise of Anna Sebastian Perayil on July 20, four months after joining her first job at global advisory and accounting firm EY in Pune, has sparked a debate on social media about toxic work cultures at corporate organisations.The debate was triggered a few days back after a letter from Perayil's mother, Anita Augustine, went viral in which she addressed EY India chairman Rajiv Memani and blamed "the workload, new environment, and long hours" for her daughter's tragic death.
